title: Reflective Practice and Collaborative Learning Strategies in Higher Education: Professional Development and Civic Literacy Considering Social Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory and professional experience in current fields (medical/legal/technical), understanding of social interactions, institutional contexts, and cultural diversity
context.additional_context: Professional development through reflective practice and collaborative learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments. Learners create inclusive educational environments by collaborating with peers from diverse cultural backgrounds, explore education cases considering community linkages, and seek practical strategies for social responsibility and citizenship.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically reflect on their educational field experiences and derive inclusive improvement strategies considering social relationships, cultural diversity, and institutional contexts.

Over six months, through mentoring and collaborative learning (three team projects), learners can integrate five or more of the seven TPACK knowledge domains (Technology Knowledge (TK), Pedagogical Knowledge (PK), Content Knowledge (CK), Technological Pedagogical Knowledge (TPK), Technological Content Knowledge (TCK), Pedagogical Content Knowledge (PCK), Technological Pedagogical Content Knowledge (TPACK)) into a lesson design plan, incorporate peer feedback and mentor input, and submit a final output emphasizing social interaction and citizenship development.

Based on peer feedback and community engagement, learners can analyze educational practice cases, establish professional growth strategies, and explore social responsibility as citizens and directions for improving educational systems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
